subject: Public Speaking
title: Exposure Therapy and Speaking
description: A 60-second lesson on Exposure Therapy and Speaking.

hook.text: The most effective treatment for public speaking anxiety is also the simplest: do it more.

buildup.text: Exposure therapy works by gradually confronting the feared situation until the brain learns it's not truly dangerous.

discovery.text: Studies show that 12 sessions of structured speaking practice can reduce anxiety by 50% or more in most people.

twist.text: Virtual reality exposure â€” giving speeches to digital audiences â€” works nearly as well as real audiences in trials.

climax.text: The brain doesn't unlearn fear through logic. It unlearns fear through safe experience. Repetition rewires threat.

punchline.text: You can't think your way past fear. You have to speak through it.

quiz.question: How does exposure therapy reduce speaking anxiety?
options: By gradually confronting the fear until the brain learns it's safe
